column4: just making sure, this is the format your using correct? : scp  <file> <username>@<IP address or hostname>:<Destination>
you ahve to tell it what file to copy and where to put it on the other end.
and if either of them are wrong / do not exist, it will fail to execute.

no, when you opent he terminal, you need to cd to where the file is, or specify the full path like: ~/uploads/some-file-name.doc  and the destination path must also exist lile /home/some-username/upolads
